english: to get out of bed; to wake up

etymology.description: 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") + 床(床) (chuáng, "bed") = the action of rising from the bed or waking up.
etymology.interpretation: The word 起床(qǐ chuáng) combines 起(qǐ, "rise") with 床(chuáng, "bed") to describe the action of getting out of bed, signifying the transition from lying down to a wakeful state.

examples.chinese: 每天早上七点(每天早上七點)，我准时起床(我準時起床)。
examples.pinyin: Měi tiān zǎoshang qī diǎn, wǒ zhǔnshí qǐ chuáng.
examples.english: I get up on time at seven every morning.

examples.chinese: 闹钟一响(鬧鐘一響)，我就起床(我就起床)。
examples.pinyin: Nào zhōng yī xiǎng, wǒ jiù qǐ chuáng.
examples.english: As soon as the alarm rings, I get up.

examples.chinese: 上学前必须起床(上學前必須起床)，否则会迟到(否則會遲到)。
examples.pinyin: Shàng xué qián bìxū qǐ chuáng, fǒuzé huì chídào.
examples.english: I must get up before school, otherwise I'll be late.
